Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 23:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine three transformers on our electricity poles to check they are functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place in the Freezen Hill, Blue Pump Farm and Hill Farm area.

Steps.Message: Good afternoon, this is a message from Ryan at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which is currently in progress today the 20th of November 2025 in the PE28 postcode area. Our contractors have advised us that the works have progressed well, and they want to restore supplies as soon as possible to those customers who are currently off supply and were due to be restored between approximately 16:30-17:30. As a result of this, 19 properties will be restored early between approximately 15:30-16:00. We can confirm that once all properties are restored back to the main network that the works to replace 4 poles and a transformer off Grafham Road will be completed which will improve the reliability of the network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. Our reference number for this work is INCD-23625-O. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you a 10/10 service then please call us on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified 4 electricity poles and a transformer that need replacing and upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. Our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the poles and transformer. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place off Grafham Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: Following on from the planned works that were carried out on the 09/10/2025 we need to switch off your power to remove the last 2 poles and span of overhead cable associated with the under grounding of electricity cables in the area. This work could not be completed on the day due to coming across a faulty piece of equipment and vehicle issues. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely carry out the work. This work is taking place in and around Worsham Lane.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We are replacing and upgrading our network including a piece of equipment called a transformer, following a customer request for a new electricity supply. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off and upgrade the transformer. We will remove the existing one and install a new one on the same day. Once complete this work will adhere to the customer request, ensure our network can uphold the increased electricity usage in your area and it will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced multiple unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Stroud Lane.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate that some customers have been impacted by multiple unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Mill Lane.

Steps.Message: Good morning, this is a message from Harry at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which is currently in progress today the 20th November 2025 in the RH19 postcode area. The power was switched off to enable our engineers to replace and upgrade a piece of equipment called a transformer near Shepherdsgrove Lane. Our engineers have advised us that the 14 affected properties will be restored early between approximately 11:15 and 11:45. This is due to the works progressing well and being completed ahead of schedule. Once these works are complete this will improve the reliability of the electricity network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut. Our reference number for this work is INCD-326680-U. I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you a 10/10 service then please call us on 105.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close to 4 sections of cables, which could damage the cables and affect your electricity supply. Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place along Spring Road. Please note there will be two way traffic lights in place to allow the work to take place safely.

MainMessage: We are currently experiencing problems with the electricity supply in your area.  Our engineers have attended the fault, and have made an emergency repair to restore power to as many premises as possible.  It is our intention to return to make a permanent repair as soon as we can.  I'm sorry, but we can't give you a time for this at present. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 11:21 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers have connected a temporary generator on the overhead network in the Collingford Lane area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 4 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 10:49 - Thanks for bearing with us, I know having a power cut for this long must be disruptive and worrying.

Our engineers are working hard to get the faulted section of our network repaired and your lights back on, however as the issue is complex and they have given a time frame some hours in the future, we are going to get less updates from them while they focus on their repairs.

Due to this we won't be texting you as often as we might normally, but I assure you if we get any relevant information from our staff, we'll let you know as soon as possible.

Further to this our team are always here on 105, so if you have any concerns or questions let us know.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Roland at 09:38 - We're pleased to confirm our engineers that our engineers have narrowed down the fault so they may no longer connect the remaining properties to a temporary generator. We'll continue to liaise with our engineers and keep you updated. We're sorry for the disruption this power cut may be causing. If you're worried about elderly or ill neighbours, we can offer help and support to our vulnerable customers during a power cut. Find out more here: https://bit.ly/40quttu. If you have any concerns, please call us on 08003163105
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 20:36. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site.

Our engineers have had to switch off power remotely in the interest of public safely. This is due to a low overhead cable. We're sorry for this, but we'll turn power back on once our engineers have confirmed the area is safe.

We'll keep you updated with all of our progress. Sent by Luke at 12:44.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 12:27 - Originally, we believed this issue to be a fault on our network, but we have been made aware that due to overhead issue, our engineers have had to turn power off remotely in the interest of public safety.

We'll turn your power back on once they have investigated and confirmed the area is safe.

We'll continue to keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.

Steps.Message:
I wanted to let you know our staff have contacted us to advise they cannot restore your power safely from the substation.

The underground cable fault has now developed to such a point that our staff can locate it, and so we're arranging specialist engineering teams and a digging gang to pinpoint, excavate and repair it. It's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods, but it's also possible our time frame will need to change.

I'll let you know further news as soon as we get it, but if you have any concerns our team are always here on 08003163105. Sent by Aaron at 14:28.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Scott Close area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Aaron at 14:16.

Sent by Aaron at 15:50 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 1270 customers in the Cobham KT11 3 area, by diverting power around the underground network fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Cobham KT11 3 area to investigate the power cut affecting 13 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Aaron at 15:35.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Aaron at 15:04 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an underground network fault that initially interrupted power to 1270 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 13 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 18:00-19:00, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 13:36 - We can now confirm that all power in the Milbourne Place/ Curtis Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by a faulty underground connection box, which our engineers have now diverted power around the fault.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers are still on site working to restore power. They originally believed the fault to be with some equipment within our substation; however after further investigations they have discovered the fault is an underground connection box.

At the moment, we don't need to change the estimated time and we'll continue to keep you updated with progress. Sent by Roland at 12:12.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Milbourne Place/ Curtis Road area, the estimated time of 15:00 and 16:00 hasn't changed. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. There may still be some tidying up to do, and any details have been passed to our Maintenance department, who will attend to it as soon as possible. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bailey at 14:19 - We can now confirm that all power in the St Johns Street area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 10:26. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Sent by Luke at 13:40 - We can now confirm that all power in the College Road area should be back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 12:57 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the Broadway area should now be back on.

Our staff have restored your power by replacing our substation safety equipment. Following the results of their tests, the underground cable fault we believe is causing these issues has not yet become visible, so for the moment we have restored your power as fast as possible.

I'm very sorry for the continued disruption, but this may happen again before we're able to fix it. If you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 12:57 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers made partial repairs on the underground network in the Myddleton Street area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 3 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut today, our staff will work to restore your power as quickly and as safely as possible. A lot of our customers have questions regarding power cuts, and though you can always reach our team, you can also find some helpful information and answers to some of our most frequently asked questions on our website here - https://bit.ly/3pTfAz9 - Bear in mind this will use your mobile data, so feel free to speak to us if you'd prefer. We'll be in touch again once we have more information from our staff.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our team of specialist engineers have now begun to arrive on site to locate and fix the underground cable fault.

To allow time for them to complete the fix, we're now estimating to have all supplies back on between 14:00 and 15:30. We're sorry to have had to extend the time and will continue to keep you updated with all of our progress as it comes in from site. Sent by Bev at 10:40.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 11:03 - We can now confirm that all power in the Beaconsfield Close area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers are still working to restore your power.

With the cold weather, we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating. If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on asap. Sent by Kevin at 10:45.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Beaconsfield Close area, the estimated time of 12:30 and 13:30 hasn't changed. Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 04:56 - Hi David here again. Thanks for your patience today and I'm sorry for how long you were without power for. Our engineers have now repaired and re attached the overhead cable that was laying on the ground, and have deemed it safe to restore power back to all 1172 properties in the NR19 2 area.

We're very sorry we had to turn your power off unexpectedly, and with so little warning. We usually provide much more notice if we can, but in a situation like this our first priority is the safety of the public and our staff.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. If your power is still off or if you have any questions, call our team on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by David at 04:03
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi David here again. I'm sorry power is still off this morning. Our engineers have just called in to advise us that they have found an overhead cable laying on the ground in the NR19 2 area, which they are working on repairing and re erecting the cable to be able to restore your power.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 04:30 and 05:30 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by David at 02:55.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Bev at 06:29 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 2685 customers in the CM14 5, CM15 9 area, by removing a tree branch that was found to have come into contact with our overhead cabling. We understand how difficult a power cut can be, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 06:16 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are currently checking our network equipment throughout the area. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Alert from UK Power Networks at [TIME]

We own and maintain the electrical cabling and substations in London, East Anglia, and the Southeast. Due to a safety issue, we may need to switch off some power in the [postcode] area.

We usually provide advance notice for maintenance power cuts, but this is due to an unexpected network issue that could affect public safety.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bailey at 15:34 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 355 customers in the Brandon and Lakenheath area, by diverting around the fault. We're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
